{"step_by_step_thinking": "The organic component of bone is primarily made up of collagen, which is a protein that provides a soft framework, and calcium phosphate, a mineral that adds strength and hardens the framework. This combination of collagen and calcium makes bone strong and flexible enough to withstand stress. More than 90% of the organic matrix is collagen, which is the most abundant protein in the human body. However, the percentage of collagen in the organic component of bone is not as high as 90%. It is closer to 35%.", "answer_choice": "A"}
